revised_title: Sulfur Compounds in Coal-Gas and Crystallized Hydrosulphocarbonate of Lime
tldr: The author investigates the sulfur compounds in purified coal-gas and the formation of crystallized hydrosulphocarbonate of lime. They discovered that the blackening of lead salts by gas is not always due to hydrogen sulfide and that the reaction between lime and bisulfide of carbon produces a new compound. The author also describes the process of obtaining red crystallized lime salt and its properties.
